idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: World Gazetteer represents the locations and proper names for map features around the world. The gazetteer includes attribute and annotation name information from various layers of the Digital Chart of the World.
descript.purpose: World Gazetteer provides a base map layer that may be used to find locations by their proper name anywhere around the world. The categories include airports, coastal features, drainage features, land features, ocean features, islands, political features, and populated places.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

idinfo.useconst:
The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI® software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. As used herein, “Geodata” shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (e.g. .gif, .jpeg, etc.) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s). Geodata is redistributable with a Value-Added Software Application developed by ESRI Business Partners on a royalty-free basis with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s). Geodata is redistributable without a Value-Added Software Application (i.e., adding the sample data to an existing, [non]commercial data set for redistribution) with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.
Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.
Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.
THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee.
IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.
Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 909-793-3774; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the locations and proper names for map features around the world.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The proper name of the feature.
attr.attrdefs: Digital Chart of the World, ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook, Government of Nunavut

edom.edomv: Airport, Coastal feature, Drainage feature, Island, Land feature, Ocean feature, Political, Populated place

attr.attrdef: The category to which the feature pertains.

edom.edomv: Administered by another country, Administrative Region, Administrative Subdivision, Area, Atoll, Autonomous Community, Autonomous Municipality, Autonomous Region, Bay, Canal, Canton, Cape, Capital City, Capital Municipality, Capital Territory, Channel, City, Commonwealth, Constitutional Province, Continent, Controlled and administered, County, Crown dependency, Dam, Department, Dependent territory, Desert, Disputed territory, District, Division, Economic Prefecture, Emirate, Fall, Federal Dependencies, Federal District, Federal Status City, Federal Territory, Fjord, Freely associated area, General area, Glacier, Governorate, Gulf, Head, Hill(s), Independent Town, Independent state, Inland island, Inland island group, Intendancy, International, Isthmus, Lagoon, Lake, Landing, Military, Mountain, Mountains, Municipal, Municipality, National District, National Territory, Ocean, Ocean hazard, Oceanic island, Oceanic island group, Other, Other airport, Other mountains, Other ocean feature, Overseas administrative division, Overseas department, Overseas territory, Pakistan-administered, Parish, Peninsula, Point, Populated place, Prefecture, Province, Region, Republic, Reservoir, Ria, River, River mouth, Salt flat, Sea, Seasonal river, Self-governing administrative division, Self-governing commonwealth, Self-governing territory, Self-governing (freely associated), Special City, Special District, Special Municipality, Special Region, State, Strait, Territorial collectivity, Territory, To be determined, Topographic feature, Town, Unincorporated territory, Union Territory, Volcano, Well/Spring, Wetlands, Zone

attr.attrdef: The name for the geographic entity (usually a country) in which the feature is located.

edom.edomv: Named Countries, Continents, Oceans, Seas, and Gulfs
edom.edomvd: The list of types of within values.
edom.edomvds: Digital Chart of the World, ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook

attr.attrdefs: Digital Chart of the World, ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-letter) for the country in which the feature is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

citeinfo.title: Digital Chart of the World
citeinfo.origin: Defense Mapping Agency, presently known as National Imagery and Mapping Agency

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the features from the Digital Chart of the World. Restructured attributes for easier feature classifications. Updated attribute values based on political changes and other factors. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices.

citeinfo.origin: United States Department of State, Bureau of Intelligence and Research
citeinfo.title: Geographic and Global Issues Quarterly

pubinfo.publish: United States Department of State, Bureau of Intelligence and Research

citeinfo.title: THE WORLD FACTBOOK 2002
citeinfo.othercit:
In general, information available as of 1 January 2002 was used in the preparation of The World Factbook 2002.
The Factbook has been an annual publication, but selected data and maps will be updated periodically during the coming year.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated FIPS_CNTRY attribute for East Timor and Serbia & Montenegro. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated attribute values for Taiwan. Removed the Paracel and Spratly island groups.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Reduced the attribute widths for CATEGORY and DESCRIPT.

horizpa.horizpar:
The horizontal accuracy, at a 90 percent confidence level for circular error, ranges from 1,600 feet to 7,300 feet. These figures are the root sum square of Operational Navigation Chart (ONC)/Jet Navigation Chart (JNC) sheet positional errors plus the additional error introduced by the Digital Chart of the World production process.
Since the features are derived from annotation, they do not correspond with the true location because the latitude and longitude coordinate values were derived from the annotation location rather than the map feature itself. Locations taken from annotation are based on the lower left corner of the first letter. Also, the names associated with fuzzy polygons may occur anywhere in the general area of the feature. For example, the name 'Rocky Mountains' is a point located somewhere in the general area covered by the term Rocky Mountains. Fuzzy polygon names, which appeared on more than one ONC sheet, will occur more than once.

dataqual.logic: No duplicate features are present. The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format in ArcSDE®. This verifies and validates the geometry. The data set is created directly from a topologically correct ArcInfo® coverage.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descKeys.keyword: point, gazetteer, airports, coastal features, drainage features, islands, land features, ocean features, political features, populated places, location, oceans, transportation

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr:
ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telesales staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.
distorOrdPrc.resFees: Software purchase price. ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software. To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

dataLineage.statement:
DCW (source 1 of 8)
ESRI, Defense Mapping Agency, presently known as National Imagery and Mapping Agency, 1992, Digital Chart of the World: ESRI, Redlands, California, USA.
Type of source media: CD–ROM Source scale denominator: 1000000 Source contribution: Attribute and geospatial data
Geographic and Global Issues (source 2 of 8)
United States Department of State, Bureau of Intelligence and Research, Winter 1993/1994, Geographic and Global Issues Quarterly: Geographic and Global Issues Quarterly Volume 3, Number 4, United States Department of State, Bureau of Intelligence and Research, Washington, DC, USA.
Type of source media: paper Source contribution: Attribute data
CIA Factbook (source 3 of 8)
United States Central Intelligence Agency, 20000101, The World Factbook 2000: The World Factbook 2000, United States Central Intelligence Agency, Washington, DC, USA.
Type of source media: online Source contribution: Attribute data
ArcWorld Supplement (source 4 of 8)
ESRI, 1996, ArcWorld™ Supplement: ESRI, Redlands, California, USA.
Type of source media: CD–ROM Source scale denominator: 3000000 Source contribution: Attribute data
www.gov.nu.ca (source 5 of 8)
Government of Nunavut, : Government of Nunavut, online.
Online links: http://www.gov.nu.ca
Type of source media: online Source contribution: Attribute data
CIA Factbook 2002 (source 6 of 8)
United States Central Intelligence Agency, 20020101, THE WORLD FACTBOOK 2002: The World Factbook 2002, United States Central Intelligence Agency, online.
Online links: http://www.odci.gov/cia/publications/factbook/
Other citation details: In general, information available as of 1 January 2002 was used in the preparation of The World Factbook 2002. The Factbook has been an annual publication, but selected data and maps will be updated periodically during the coming year.
Type of source media: online Source contribution: Attribute data
http://www.iso.ch (source 7 of 8)
International Organization for Standardization, 20021115, Updates on ISO 3166: International Organization for Standardization, online.
Online links: http://www.iso.ch/iso/en/prods-services/iso3166ma/03updates-on-iso-3166/nlv6e-tl.html
Other citation details: ISO 3166-1 NEWSLETTER No. V-6 [20021115]
Type of source media: online Source contribution: Attribute data
GMI (source 8 of 8)
Global Mapping International, Missions Database: Global Mapping International, Colorado Springs, Colorado, USA.
Online links: http://www.gmi.org
Type of source media: CD–ROM Source contribution: Attribute data
Date: 20010112 (change 1 of 4) The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the features from the Digital Chart of the World. Restructured attributes for easier feature classifications. Updated attribute values based on political changes and other factors. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices.
Data sources used in this process: DCW Geographic and Global Issues CIA Factbook ArcWorld Supplement www.gov.nu.ca
Date: 20020924 (change 2 of 4) The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated FIPS_CNTRY attribute for East Timor and Serbia & Montenegro. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
Data sources used in this process: CIA Factbook 2002
Date: 20040921 (change 3 of 4) The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated attribute values for Taiwan. Removed the Paracel and Spratly island groups.
Data sources used in this process: http://www.iso.ch GMI CIA Factbook
Date: 20050211 (change 4 of 4) The following steps were performed by ESRI: Reduced the attribute widths for CATEGORY and DESCRIPT.
